greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of divisors d of n of the form d == 3 (mod 8).
comment: a(3n) >= 1 as the divisor d=3 contributes to the count then.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
M. D. Hirschhorn, The number of representations of a number by various forms, Discrete Mathematics 298 (2005), 205-211.
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} x^(3*k)/(1 - x^(8*k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 11 2019
maple: sigmamr := proc(n,m,r) local a,d ; a := 0 ; for d in numtheory[divisors](n) do if modp(d,m) = r then a := a+1 ; end if; end do: a; end proc:
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 23 2011
